summary: J. Patrick Coyne is mentioned in documents spanning from 1962 to 1964, primarily in the context of the President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board (PFIAB) meetings. While his specific role is not explicitly detailed, his presence in these meetings suggests involvement in discussions concerning intelligence matters, including CIA activities, covert operations, national reconnaissance programs, and intelligence operations related to Cuba, Vietnam, and the Soviet Union. He participated in high-level discussions with the Director of Central Intelligence and other key figures.
significance: Medium. J.
